parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  The content focuses on the conflict in Ukraine and its international political implications, not on any particular candidate running for parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a specific individual or small group. The broad topic of the Ukraine conflict also suggests a wide audience.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post is to inform the public about the ongoing conflict in Ukraine and its geopolitical ramifications. While the topic is political, there is no explicit or implicit attempt to influence voters' choices in the upcoming parliamentary elections. The post does not endorse or criticize any candidate or party.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents itself as a news summary, providing information on recent developments related to the war in Ukraine. The style and content align with journalistic standards of reporting factual information, although it is presented through a specific media outlet's lens.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express personal opinions or subjective viewpoints. It presents information in a relatively neutral manner, summarizing news from various sources.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>497160306678863</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while dealing with a political topic, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post focuses on the Ukraine conflict, a matter of international relations, and does not promote or oppose any candidate or party participating in the Romanian parliamentary elections.  It lacks any direct or indirect call to action related to voting for or against a specific candidate. The content is presented in a journalistic style, summarizing news related to the conflict.  The paid nature of the post on a public platform does not automatically qualify it as electoral propaganda if the content itself does not meet the legal criteria.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Strategic Media Team srl</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
